name: Circle
comment:
Circle class provides static functions to create and operate on circles. A circle is usually represented as a Group of 2 Pts, where the first Pt specifies the center, and the second Pt specifies the radius.
You can use the static functions as-is, or apply the [`Group.op`](#link) or [`Pt.op`](#link) to enable functional programming.
See [Op guide](../guide/Op-0400.html) for details.

signatures.comment: Create a circle based on a center point and a radius.
signatures.returns_comment: a Group that represents a circle

parameters.name: pt
parameters.comment: center point of circle

parameters.name: radius
parameters.comment: radius of circle

signatures.comment: Create a circle that either fits within, or encloses, a rectangle.
signatures.returns_comment: a Group that represents a circle

parameters.name: pts
parameters.comment: a Group of 2 Pts representing a rectangle

parameters.name: enclose
parameters.comment: if `true`, the circle will enclose the rectangle. Default is `false`, which will fit the circle inside the rectangle.

signatures.comment: Create a circle that either fits within, or encloses, a triangle. Same as [`Triangle.circumcircle`](#link) or [`Triangle.incircle`](#link).
signatures.returns_comment: a Group that represents a circle

parameters.name: pts
parameters.comment: a Group of 3 Pts representing a rectangle

parameters.name: enclose
parameters.comment: if `true`, the circle will enclose the triangle. Default is `false`, which will fit the circle inside the triangle.

signatures.comment: Get the intersection points between two circles.
signatures.returns_comment: a Group of intersection points, or an empty Group if no intersection is found

parameters.name: pts
parameters.comment: a Group of 2 Pts representing a circle

parameters.name: circle
parameters.comment: a Group of 2 Pts representing a circle

signatures.comment: Get the intersection points between a circle and a line segment.
signatures.returns_comment: a Group of intersection points, or an empty Group if no intersection is found

parameters.name: pts
parameters.comment: a Group of 2 Pts representing a circle

signatures.comment: Get the intersection points between a circle and a ray (infinite line).
signatures.returns_comment: a Group of intersection points, or an empty Group if no intersection is found

parameters.name: pts
parameters.comment: a Group of 2 Pts representing a circle

parameters.name: ray
parameters.comment: a Group of 2 Pts representing a ray

signatures.comment:
Quick way to check rectangle intersection with a circle.
For more optimized implementation, store the rectangle's sides separately (eg, [`Rectangle.sides`](#link)) and use [`Polygon.intersectPolygon2D()`](#link).
signatures.returns_comment: a Group of intersection points, or an empty Group if no intersection is found

parameters.name: pts
parameters.comment: a Group of 2 Pts representing a circle

parameters.name: rect
parameters.comment: a Group of 2 Pts representing a rectangle

signatures.comment: Get a rectangle that either fits within or encloses this circle. See also [`Rectangle.toCircle`](#link)

parameters.name: pts
parameters.comment: a Group of 2 Pts representing a circle

parameters.name: within
parameters.comment: if `true`, the rectangle will be within the circle. If `false`, the rectangle will enclose the circle.

signatures.comment: Get a triangle that fits within this circle.

parameters.name: pts
parameters.comment: a Group of 2 Pts representing a circle

parameters.name: within
parameters.comment: if `true`, the triangle will be within the circle. If `false`, the triangle will enclose the circle.

signatures.comment: Check if a point is within a circle.

parameters.name: pts
parameters.comment: a Group of 2 Pts representing a circle

parameters.name: pt
parameters.comment: the point to checks

parameters.name: threshold
parameters.comment: an optional small number to set threshold. Default is 0.
